name: Java
points: Building OOP projects.
Don't mind the verbose syntax (most of the time).
Go to language to practice Data Structures and Algorithms

name: Python

Favorite language for rapid prototyping and experiments.

name: Node.js
points: The indispensible JavaScript runtime.
I've used Node more times than I remember.
`npm install success`

name: TypeScript
points: It's JS but with types.
Was painful to adapt to in an existing project.
Don't think I can go back to plain JS...

points: Container1

Was a pleasure to work with for ClickClack,

name: Express.js

name: PostgreSQL
points: My favorite flavor of SQL.
Great support on many platforms.

name: Rust
points: Currently learning this language.
Very powerful stuff!

name: OCaml
points: My first Functional language
Was painful at first
Made me understand and appreciate Recursion and Pattern matching!

name: Supabase
points: I love Supabase!
Made hosting a DB for ClickClack super simple.
I Look forward to explore more of its features in future projects!

name: Jira
points: It's alright I guess...

name: Asana
points: In my opinion the simplest and cleanest task management app.
Super intuitive to use
BCIT's DTC campus was two blocks from their Vancouver office!

name: Figma
points: Figma doesn't need introduction
Made wireframes for apps like PCRigger
Adapted designs to code for 'Community of Guardians' upcoming website.

name: Flask
points: My first non-JS backend framework
Python servers are neat.
Flask does abstract some typical API logic, took a bit to notice it.

name: MySQL
points: Used it at PHSA.
I've nothing else to say.

name: MongoDB
points: Good for small projects
Like all NoSQL loses that relational-power.
Is it losing popularity?ðŸ¤”

name: Redis
points: My first in-memory storage solution.
I used Redis to store session data in AudioReaper's backend.
Typically runs in a Docker container.

name: Astro
points: Fun and Fast static website framework.
Supports components from other UI frameworks.

name: Kotlin
points: The native language for Android development,
I've only used it at BCIT to learn mobile dev.
Kotlin devs swear it's the next step of Java's evolution.

name: Go
points: Fast and powerful concurrency with Go Routines.
TS's compiler is being rewritten in it.
Project Vitalis is built in Go, and I want to use it more.

name: Heroku
points: I've decent experience with Heroku.
Always have to re-consult their docs.

name: postman

name: React
points: Everything's built in React...
I find it heavy at times.
This website, proudly, isn't React.

name: PowerShell
points: My main tool for scripting at PHSA.
